---
title: "Using demoR with Code Chunks"
author: "Kelly Bodwin"
output: html_document
---

```{r}
#knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(demoR)
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
```


```{r how-to-plot, eval = FALSE, echo = FALSE}

thing <-              1:10

    ggplot(, aes(x =thing)) + geom_histogram()  #commenting
    
    
#I am a comment

```

What the first chunk looks like:

````

```{r how-to-plot, include = FALSE}`r ''`

thing <-              1:10

    plot(thing)  #commenting
    
    
#I am a comment

```

````


What the second chunk looks like:
````

```{r, echo = FALSE}`r ''`

create_demo("how_to_plot") %>% 
  hlt_funs() %>% 
  hlt_regexp("#[^\n]*")
```

````

Knitted Output:

```{r, echo = FALSE}

demo_chunk("how-to-plot")



```


There is also a direct-from-string option, which is a good way to demonstrate broken code:


```{r, error = TRUE}
demo_code('

thing <- 1:10

plot(thing)

') %>% hlt_funs()
```

```{r, error = TRUE}
demo_code('

thing <- 1:10

plot(thing

', eval_here = FALSE) %>% hlt_funs()
```
